title: 送聖約翰救傷隊少青團助理總監一程

replies.msg:
英文唔係咁好, 心急作左篇投訴信, 各位巴絲隨便改正使用

電郵: info@orderofstjohn.org

Your Majesty and your representative in The Order of St John,

I am sure your majesty aware of the political environment and the difficulties people in Hong Kong are facing. Our unarmed children and teenagers are facing brutal violence attack from the government political enforcers.

While it’s understandable that Order of St John should stand as political neutral, it’s also known that Order of St John provided their noble and selfless service to the world’s citizens, especially the people in need. In desperate need of help, We plea for support of the Order of St John to provide their medical services to the peaceful protesters of Hong Kong.

As your can see in the international media coverage, In these peaceful non-violence protest we are facing brutal attacks, Many injuries result in this unlawful attacks.

There are reports of St. John Ambulance Hong Kong NT published a notice to withdraw and prohibit their team leaders and members to provide first-aid service for the coming days of protest. While we understand it’s their leader’s responsibility to maintain the personal well being of their members, Hong Kong people are in dire need of help on medical attention.

There had been reports of heavy injuries by close range rubber bullet and tear gas canisters (Which includes protesters and journalists). Immediate first aid is what kept some of the victim alive and we plea for support from St. John Ambulance to lower the casualties.

Thank you for your precious time.

Sincerely,

Hong Kong Citizen XXXX

14 June 2019
睇唔明，不過都幫你推一推

唔做 research 都唔知原來 Order of St John 大佬係英女皇...
https://www.stjohninternational.org/the-order

The Order
The Order of St John formally known as The Most Venerable Order of the Hospital of Saint John of Jerusalem, is a Royal Order of Chivalry first constituted as such by Royal Charter from Queen Victoria in 1888. Currently Queen Elizabeth II is the Sovereign Head of The Order of St John, followed by the Grand Prior, Prince Richard, Duke of Gloucester.
